org.jplot2d.element

Interface XYGraph

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, Graph, PComponent
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    XYGraphEx
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    XYGraphImpl

    public interface XYGraph
extends Graph
    A Graph to display X/Y chart.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  XYGraph.ChartType 
      static class  XYGraph.FillClosureType
      Defines how close the line for filling.

        Returns if symbols are drawn on the location of data points.

      • setSymbolVisible

        Sets if symbols are drawn on the location of data points.
        Parameters:
        symbolVisible - true to draw symbols; otherwise, hide the symbols

      • getSymbolSize

        float getSymbolSize()
        Returns the size of symbols in pt (1/72 inch).
        Returns:
        the size of symbols

      • setSymbolSize

        void setSymbolSize(float size)
        Sets the size of symbols in pt (1/72 inch). The default size is 8.0 pt.
        Parameters:
        size - the size of symbols

      • getSymbolColor

        java.awt.Color getSymbolColor()
        Returns the overall color of the symbols.
        Returns:
        the Color of the symbols, can be null

      • setSymbolColor

        void setSymbolColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Set the overall color of the symbols. If the given color is null, the color of the symbols will be the same of the color of the line.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the symbols

      • getIndSymbolColor

        java.awt.Color getIndSymbolColor(int idx)
        Returns the special color for data point idx. Or null if the data point use the overall symbol color.
        Parameters:
        idx - data point idx
        Returns:
        the color for data point idx.

      • setIndSymbolColor

        void setIndSymbolColor(int idx,
                     java.awt.Color color)
        Sets special color to the data point index. This method can be called many times to assign different color to the given index.
        Parameters:
        idx - the data point index
        color - the symbol color

      • setIndSymbolColor

        void setIndSymbolColor(int[] idxes,
                     java.awt.Color color)
        Sets special color to the given data point indexes. This method can be called many times to assign different color to the given indexes.
        Parameters:
        idxes - the data point indexes
        color - the symbol color

      • clearIndSymbolColor

        void clearIndSymbolColor()
        Clear individual symbol colors and reset all data point to the overall symbol color, which assigned by setSymbolColor(Color)

        Returns true if the chart line is visible.

      • isFillEnabled

        boolean isFillEnabled()
        Returns if the filling is enabled. The filling can be applied to a closed line, or the area between the line and an axis.
        Returns:
        true if the filling is enabled

      • setFillEnabled

        void setFillEnabled(boolean fillEnabled)
        Sets if the filling is enabled. The filling can be applied to a closed line, or the area between the line and an axis. The default value is false.
        Parameters:
        fillEnabled - the flag

      • getFillPaint

        java.awt.Paint getFillPaint()
        Returns the paint object to be used to fill the area.
        Returns:
        the paint object

      • setFillPaint

        void setFillPaint(java.awt.Paint paint)
        Sets the paint object to be used to fill the area. The default paint is Color(192, 192, 192, 128).
        Parameters:
        paint - the paint object

      • getFillClosureType

        XYGraph.FillClosureType getFillClosureType()
        Returns the method type to close the line for filling.
        Returns:
        the closure type

      • setFillClosureType

        void setFillClosureType(XYGraph.FillClosureType type)
        Sets the method type to close the line for filling. The default value is FillClosureType.SELF
        Parameters:
        type - the closure type

      • getErrorbarCapSize

        float getErrorbarCapSize()
        Returns the errorbar cap size in pt. If the cap size is 0, no cap is drawn.
        Returns:
        the errorbar cap size

      • setErrorbarCapSize

        void setErrorbarCapSize(float size)
        Sets the errorbar cap size in pt. The default cap size is 0, means no cap is drawn.
        Parameters:
        size - the errorbar cap size
